member.name: ACTRL_ACCESS_ENTRYA
member.summary: Contains access-control information for a specified trustee. This structure stores information equivalent to the access-control information stored in an ACE.

member.name: ACTRL_ACCESS_ENTRYA.Trustee
member.summary: A structure that identifies the user, group, or program (such as a service) to which the access-control entry applies.

summary.para: Indicates how the access rights specified by the Access and ProvSpecificAccess members apply to the trustee. This member can be one of the following values. If you are using this structure with the COM implementation of , this member must be ACTRL_ACCESS_ALLOWED or ACTRL_ACCESS_DENIED.

listheader.description: Value
Meaning
The rights are allowed.
The rights are denied.
The system generates audit messages for failed attempts to use the rights.
The system generates audit messages for successful attempts to use the rights.

summary.para: A bitmask that specifies the access rights that the entry allows, denies, or audits for the trustee.

This member must use the provider-independent access flags, such as ACTRL_READ_CONTROL, rather than access flags such as READ_CONTROL. The provider for the object type converts these provider-independent flags to the corresponding provider-specific flags.
If you are using this structure with the COM implementation of , this member must be COM_RIGHTS_EXECUTE.

member.name: ACTRL_ACCESS_ENTRYA.ProvSpecificAccess
member.summary: A bitmask that specifies access rights specific to the provider type. The functions that use the ACTRL_ACCESS_ENTRY structure pass these bits on to the provider without interpreting them. In most cases, this member should be 0.

summary.para: A set of bit flags that determines whether other containers or objects can inherit the access-control entry from the primary object to which the access list is attached. If you are using this structure with the COM implementation of , this value must be NO_INHERITANCE, which indicates that the access-control entry is not inheritable. Otherwise, this value can be NO_INHERITANCE or it can be a combination of the following values.

listheader.description: Value
Meaning
Other containers that are contained by the primary object inherit the entry.
The ACE does not apply to the primary object to which the ACL is attached, but objects contained by the primary object inherit the entry.
The OBJECT_INHERIT_ACE and CONTAINER_INHERIT_ACE flags are not propagated to an inherited entry.
Noncontainer objects contained by the primary object inherit the entry.

Both containers and noncontainer objects that are contained by the primary object inherit the entry. This flag corresponds to the combination of the CONTAINER_INHERIT_ACE and OBJECT_INHERIT_ACE flags.
Other containers that are contained by the primary object inherit the entry. This flag corresponds to the CONTAINER_INHERIT_ACE flag.
Noncontainer objects contained by the primary object inherit the entry. This flag corresponds to the OBJECT_INHERIT_ACE flag.

member.name: ACTRL_ACCESS_ENTRYA.lpInheritProperty
member.summary: A pointer to a null-terminated string that identifies the object types that can inherit the entry. If you are using this structure with the COM implementation of , this member must be NULL.

member.name: ACTRL_ACCESS_ENTRYA
member.summary: Contains access-control information for a specified trustee. This structure stores information equivalent to the access-control information stored in an ACE.

member.summary: A structure that identifies the user, group, or program (such as a service) to which the access-control entry applies.

summary.para: Indicates how the access rights specified by the Access and ProvSpecificAccess members apply to the trustee. This member can be one of the following values. If you are using this structure with the COM implementation of , this member must be ACTRL_ACCESS_ALLOWED or ACTRL_ACCESS_DENIED.

listheader.description: Value
Meaning
The rights are allowed.
The rights are denied.
The system generates audit messages for failed attempts to use the rights.
The system generates audit messages for successful attempts to use the rights.

member.name: ACTRL_ACCESS_ENTRYA.ProvSpecificAccess
member.summary: A bitmask that specifies access rights specific to the provider type. The functions that use the ACTRL_ACCESS_ENTRY structure pass these bits on to the provider without interpreting them. In most cases, this member should be 0.

summary.para: A set of bit flags that determines whether other containers or objects can inherit the access-control entry from the primary object to which the access list is attached. If you are using this structure with the COM implementation of , this value must be NO_INHERITANCE, which indicates that the access-control entry is not inheritable. Otherwise, this value can be NO_INHERITANCE or it can be a combination of the following values.

listheader.description: Value
Meaning
Other containers that are contained by the primary object inherit the entry.
The ACE does not apply to the primary object to which the ACL is attached, but objects contained by the primary object inherit the entry.
The OBJECT_INHERIT_ACE and CONTAINER_INHERIT_ACE flags are not propagated to an inherited entry.
Noncontainer objects contained by the primary object inherit the entry.

Both containers and noncontainer objects that are contained by the primary object inherit the entry. This flag corresponds to the combination of the CONTAINER_INHERIT_ACE and OBJECT_INHERIT_ACE flags.
Other containers that are contained by the primary object inherit the entry. This flag corresponds to the CONTAINER_INHERIT_ACE flag.
Noncontainer objects contained by the primary object inherit the entry. This flag corresponds to the OBJECT_INHERIT_ACE flag.

summary.para: A pointer to a null-terminated string that identifies the object types that can inherit the entry. If you are using this structure with the COM implementation of , this member must be NULL.
